intro: Ledebouria galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's bulbous lily, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear clusters of white or pale purple flowers. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil and minimal watering. Ledebouria galpinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
